name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Boston Milford

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for three nights and my experience was very positive. The rooms and the breakfast area are nothing special, but they were kept very clean and the front desk was very friendly and helpful. There are many restaurants within a few minute drive, and the front desk gave me a very comprehensive list of eateries in the area with directions. The room rate is reasonable considering complimentary breakfast and high speed internet .
reviews.title: Good choice for business travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located near the exit from I-495 and easy to find.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: I don't like the styling and design of the fairfield bran ( they could learn something from "hyatt place") but other then that the hotel is convinient, clean, and gives good service. When we asked to move to a different room (because the room facing the main road was too noisy) we were immediately moved. The hotel has a nice fitness room and a small pool and hot tub.
reviews.title: Typical Marriott-great service with no unpleasant surprises

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in April 2009 for a business trip and it was great. A newer hotel in the area, it was clean, quiet, and the service was excellent. Much better than the DoubleTree (behind Kmart), or other older hotels in the area. The location is excellent, right near I-495 with good shopping and restaurants (such as TGI Firdays) nearby. Free breakfast, nice clean rooms, friendly and courteous staff, excellent service. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation.
reviews.title: Great combination of price and comfort

reviews.text: Hotel is 1/2 mile from I-495 (aka Rt 128). Building is quiet--there was a big wedding party while we were there and we didn't hear a thing. Staff very helpful--directed us to a capable tire store when we had a flat. Free breakfast perfectly adequate.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, but no where for family to gather.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel December 10th - 14th. Our room was nice, clean, and quiet. The front desk staff at this hotel is always friendly and helpful, but this time, they went above & beyond. We left an expensive shirt in our room. The front desk clerk called our home phone in Tennessee to let us know & said to call back to let them know what to do. Fortunately, I had a family member pick it up, but I'm sure the hotel would have shipped it to us if I'd asked. We visit this area a few times a year, and this is our favorite hotel to stay in!
reviews.title: Excellent customer service!
Average At Best
reviews.text: On a recent trip to Boston we spent one night at this property. It was close to a large Outlet Mall which was a prime factor in choosing it's location. If you've seen one Fairfiled Inn you've seen them all. It did seem a bit pricey for what you got, but this is the Boston area. The indoor pool and spa were nice but the beds were not very comfortable at all. The mattress was a three in slab of foam rubber. The continental breakfast was also ho-hum. It you are passing through and have few other options it's OK, but I'd look elsewhere if I had to choose again.
Excellent hotel - clean, comfortable, and good service.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay with Great Staff

likes.liked: — Clean, good value, and two blocks from highway. Indoor pool is heated - nice.
likes.disliked: — No comments - can not think of any dislikes.

reviews.text: Enjoyed the Brazilian lady who worked the breakfast area each morning as she would make waffles (or other hot items) for you and bring them to you! Very friendly person. Breakfast is free.
reviews.title: I had an excellent two day stay here

reviews.text: Nice indoor pool (heated) and spa (a bit hot). Stayed 3 days and enjoyed the easy on/off of the highway (2 blocks away) and very close to eating places & some major retailers for shopping.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Fairfield
Boston Marathon Super Service
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights in Aug 2008, stayed in the king suite, which was only $10 more per night. The king suite had a sitting area with a pull out sofa. I believe it was worth the $10.
Everything at this hotel was superb. The front desk personnel were very friendly and were eager to make sure our stay was pleasant.
reviews.title: Worked for me. Typical Fairfield Inn with friendly staff
